Jasny\HttpMessage\Uri\Path::withPath

Return an instance with the specified path.

The path can either be empty or absolute (starting with a slash) or rootless (not starting with a slash). If an HTTP path is intended to be host-relative rather than path-relative then it must begin with a slash ("/"). HTTP paths not starting with a slash are assumed to be relative to some base path known to the application or consumer.

    Signature

    public function withPath(string $path )

    Parameters

    $path — string
    The path to use with the new instance.

    Returns

    Path
    A new instance with the specified path.

    Errors/Exceptions

    InvalidArgumentException
    for invalid paths.
